DPi.content: anesthetize DP, uncruel, would have to think through Kant & Husserl on sensibility
against cruelty, humanize DP, change mode of DP not principle (hypocrisy of emotion spilt on cruelty of DP: still preserve cruel enjoyment of spectacle)
Furman v. Georgia ruling on “cruel & unusual” punishment not against DP in principle
anesthetize DP (follows rhythm of nighttime up until dawn) like nocturnal council (dawn, fascination, theater, coldness of machine)
coldness, cruelty, heartless machinism of guillotine, hard and cold like a machine (again juxtaposed to woman, who is apolitical, private, warm)
moment of anesthesia: heighten suspense (in films)
when U.S. reinstated DP, DP was only criticized for being cruel & unusual to sensibility & imagination, in sense of aisthesis, phantasia, phantasma
for Schopenhauer, aesthetics not a disinterest but an anesthetic
sans sang (U.S., Eucharist—real presence of blood of God): interiorization of blood in noncruel DP > turning point as a return, ce trop ou ce trope of blood

Cartesianism of Guillotin/guillotine, not only mechanism of individualism/egalitarian universalism, but also body/mind (Cartesian doxa, ideology), but also Descartes’ instantaneism (separate, indivisible instants) as part of anesthetic logic of moment of guillotine
would the mind only know it was severed from its head when the crowd cheers? other determines instant of my death
guillotine as pain killer: instant, no sensibility of duration of time: anesthesia—euthanasia—instantaneity
can one desire, what is really called desire, an anesthetic?—pure intelligibility (sur-viving beyond life), death as absolute anesthetic

Montaigne: fairest death is the most willed death, pulled like a thread > Derrida imagines [via fil of life, filet of blood] a tireless trapeze artist who is caught by net of belief, his opinion, dies on day net breaks, a willed/beautiful death > he decides to put an end to his belief
religion as anesthetic for death & DP

TN.content: “this” and “here” of body (its sublimating idealization) makes it inaccessible to touch > an anesthesia of anesthesia, euthanasia contract
[is Christianity the only idealizing anesthesia, neutralization, universalism—or one case?]
for Derrida, epochē divides contact at its heart, anesthetizing it from the threshold of its possibility, for 2 reasons: 1) suspends reality of contact 2) noematic can’t pertain to touched thing

anesthetic interruption in heart of aesthetic phenomenality, anesthetics very ecstasy at heart of pleasure, pleasure as differance w/out delay > plier, prier and invent substitutes, prostheses, fetishes, cultures, technics (all of “history,” before and beyond “hand of man”)
